name: acetamide, 2-chloro-n-(2-methyl-2h-benzotriazol-
Reason: 2-chloro-N-(2-methyl-2H-benzotriazol-5-yl)acetamide is a compound with several functional groups. The basic unit we can compare to is acetamide, which has a melting point of around 82 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 2-chloro-N-(2-methyl-2H-benzotriazol-5-yl)acetamide will affect its melting point: (1) The 2-methyl-2H-benzotriazol-5-yl group is a rigid ring structure that can increase the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight, adding about +50; (2) The chlorine atom is an electronegative atom that can increase the melting point due to stronger intermolecular dipole-dipole interactions, adding about +10; (3) The acetamide group (ClCC(=O)N) includes functionalities related to amides, which can significantly increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding, adding about +30. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
